title: Sushi Rolls
description: Classic Japanese sushi rolls made with seasoned rice, nori sheets, and fresh fillings such as cucumber, avocado, and salmon.
instructions: Rinse the sushi rice several times until the water runs clear, then cook it according to package instructions.
While the rice is still warm, mix it gently with rice vinegar, sugar, and salt to create seasoned sushi rice. Let it cool completely.
Lay a bamboo sushi mat on a flat surface and place a nori sheet on top, shiny side down.
Spread a thin, even layer of sushi rice over the nori, leaving a small border at the top edge free for sealing.
Place thin slices of cucumber, avocado, and fresh salmon horizontally across the bottom third of the rice.
Lift the edge of the bamboo mat and roll the sushi forward tightly, applying gentle pressure to shape a firm roll.
Wet the top edge of the nori to seal the roll, then remove it from the mat.
Slice the roll into even pieces using a sharp, wet knife and serve with soy sauce, wasabi, and pickled ginger.
